title: Neural Networks
subtitle: The Building Blocks of AI
content: Neural networks are computational models inspired by the human brain. They consist of interconnected nodes that process and transmit information.

title: How Neurons Work
content: Each neuron receives input signals, processes them using an activation function, and passes the result to the next layer. This simple mechanism, when replicated thousands of times, creates powerful learning systems.

title: Network Architecture
content:
Neural networks are organized in layers: input, hidden, and output. Deep learning uses multiple hidden layers for complex pattern recognition.

keyTakeaway: Deep networks use multiple hidden layers for complex pattern recognition.

title: Training Process
quote: A neural network learns by adjusting weights through backpropagation, minimizing the difference between predicted and actual outputs.
author: Geoffrey Hinton
content: The training process involves feeding data forward, calculating error, and propagating corrections backward through the network.

title: AI Performance Metrics
content: Modern neural networks achieve superhuman performance in many specialized tasks.

title: Quick Check
question: What is the primary function of an activation function in a neural network?
explanation: Activation functions introduce non-linearity, allowing networks to learn complex patterns beyond simple linear relationships.
